Candan Herdem is a postdoctoral researcher of HCI and Design. She is, broadly, interested in “computational tool design” to support human activities, such as design of devices, apps, interfaces etc. She focuses on order and sequence of events/actions of the objects in the contexts external to human. She applies hci and design methods while designing for computational tools.

She has a PhD degree in Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) from Iowa State University, and a BSc. degree in Computer Engineering (CEng) from Erciyes University. She attended to International SUmmer School in Affective Sciences, organized by Swiss Center for Affective Sciences, University of Geneva. She has a certificate as a result of completion of 3 credits graduate course on affective sciences.

She looks for a research position at academic institutions or research labs in the industry. Download her job package (CV, statements of research, teaching and diversity)
